item.title: Service disruption: Google Sheets and Looker Studio, February 26, 2024
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Google Experiencing Issues with Supermetrics and Looker Studio

Google is facing issues causing the Supermetrics sidebar not to load in Google Sheets and the home page and reports not to load in Looker Studio. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation with Google and return our service to normal.

Feb 26, 11:13 EET
Investigating - Google is experiencing issues that may cause the Supermetrics sidebar not to load in Google Sheets and the home page and reports not to load in Looker Studio. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation with Google and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service Disruption: Criteo, February 14, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Feb 14, 19:36 EET
Resolved - The issue that Criteo was experiencing has been resolved, and the Supermetrics for Criteo connector is now retrieving data normally.

Thank you for your patience and understanding!

Feb 14, 16:24 EET
Investigating - Criteo is currently experiencing a partial outage which is affecting our ability to retrieve data from its API.

We are monitoring the situation from Criteo’s status page and will provide an update in the next 18 hours.

item.title: Supermetrics services, January 30, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Jan 30, 17:06 EET
Resolved - All service issues have been resolved. Supermetrics products are working as normal. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Jan 30, 16:54 EET
Monitoring - We’ve deployed a fix to resolve the issue and are closely monitoring the situation. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

Jan 30, 16:21 EET
Investigating - We're currently experiencing issues that are impacting Supermetrics services. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service disruption: Google Trends, January 9, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 13:47 EET
Resolved - The issue caused by Google that affected our Google Trends connector has been resolved. The Supermetrics for Google Trends connector is now retrieving data as per usual and we have not seen any issue anymore at this point.

Thank you for your patience and understanding!

Jan 18, 14:45 EET
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented from Google's side and operability of the connector has been restored.
We will however monitor the situation for the coming 24 hours to assure the issue has been fully resolved.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Jan 12, 10:34 EET
Update - We are continuing to monitor the ongoing issue with the Google Trends platform that is affecting our connector.
There has not been any progress yet from Google's side in regards to this issue or any new time estimate.
We will actively keep looking for potential workarounds and keep monitoring for any progression on Google's end.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Jan 10, 13:28 EET
Update - We are continuing to monitor the ongoing issue with the Google Trends platform that is affecting our connector.
Google has acknowledged the issue and is estimating to implement a fix within the coming 24 hours.
As this is just an estimation, we will actively keep looking for potential workarounds and keep monitoring for any progression on Google's end.

Jan 9, 22:43 EET
Update - We are continuing to monitor the ongoing issue with the Google Trends platform that is affecting our connector, while also actively investigating potential work-arounds. We will provide an update by 10 AM GMT tomorrow.

Jan 9, 16:07 EET
Investigating - Google is currently experiencing an issue that is impacting our Google Trends connector. This is causing a connection error and therefore making queries fail.

We’re actively investigating workarounds for the issue and monitoring closely if the issue gets rectified by Google.

We'll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

item.title: Service disruption: Yahoo DSP, January 8, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Jan 9, 17:22 EET
Resolved - The issue caused by Yahoo! that affected our Yahoo! DSP connector has been resolved. The Supermetrics for Yahoo! DSP connector is now retrieving data as per usual.

Our team will continue to monitor and are prepared to take quick actions should any further unexpected load degrade performance.

Thank you for your patience.

Jan 8, 17:03 EET
Monitoring - Yahoo is currently experiencing an issue that is impacting our Yahoo DSP connector. This issue leads to most, if not all, queries from the Yahoo DSP connector to fail.

We’ve deployed a workaround to circumvent the issue and are closely monitoring the situation while we await further response from Yahoo!

We'll provide an additional update in the next 18 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Jan 8, 13:32 EET
Investigating - Yahoo is currently experiencing an issue that is impacting our Yahoo DSP connector. This issue leads to most, if not all, queries from the Yahoo DSP connector to fail.

We've reached out to Yahoo and are awaiting their identification of the root cause. We are also checking for a workaround on our side to restore service.

We'll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

item.title: Service disruption: Instagram Insights, December 4, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Dec 5, 12:56 EET
Resolved - The issue caused by Meta that affected our Instagram Insights connector has been resolved. The Supermetrics for Instagram Insights connector is now retrieving data for “Media impressions” and “Media reach” metrics as usual.

For Google Sheets, Looker Studio, and Excel products, kindly refresh the impacted queries or dashboard. For Data Warehouse products, please execute a backfill for the runs that were affected.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Dec 5, 11:21 EET
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented by Meta and we are closely monitoring the results for any additional issues.

To retrieve data for the "Media impressions" and "Media reach" fields, kindly refresh the impacted queries or dashboard. For Data Warehouse products, please execute a backfill for the runs that were affected.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Dec 4, 16:24 EET
Update - Meta is currently experiencing an issue that is impacting our Instagram Insights connector. This issue may cause no data for the "Media impressions" and "Media reach" fields.

We've submitted a bug report to Meta and are awaiting their identification of the root cause.

We'll provide an additional update in the next 18 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Dec 4, 10:39 EET
Investigating - Meta is currently experiencing an issue that is impacting our Instagram Insights connector. This issue may cause no data for the "Media impressions" and "Media reach" fields.

We've submitted a bug report to Meta and are awaiting their identification of the root cause.

We'll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

item.title: Service disruption: Data Warehouse, December 4, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Dec 4, 16:04 EET
Resolved - The issues that have impacted our Data warehouse Hub services have been resolved.

We are running the backfill for the affected transfers from our side. No actions are required from the customer's end.

We appreciate your patience and understanding.

Dec 4, 14:43 EET
Identified - We’ve identified the root cause of the issues that have impacted our Data warehouse Hub services.

Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. No actions are required from the customer's end, and we will run the backfill for the affected transfers from our side.

We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Dec 4, 14:18 EET
Investigating - We're currently experiencing issues that have impacted our Data warehouse Hub services. Scheduled runs of some teams haven't been scheduled after December 1, 2023.

Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. No actions are required from the customer's end, and we will run the backfill for the affected transfers from our side.

We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

item.title: Service disruption: Facebook Insights, November 7, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Nov 9, 11:32 EET
Resolved - Meta has fixed the underlying issue and we are now able to return data for reach-based fields for Facebook Insights.

For users of Supermetrics for BigQuery (Marketplace), please run a backfill for the affected dates (November 2 to November 6) following the instructions in How to backfill data in BigQuery (marketplace).

We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process. Should you have further questions about this issue, please don't hesitate to contact our support team.

Nov 8, 14:43 EET
Update - We're currently experiencing an issue with our Facebook Insights data source connector, causing some customers to encounter the below error message:

“(#100) The value must be a valid insights metric”

We have added a workaround for this that will stop fetching the reach-based metrics that cause the error (Total reach, Paid reach, Total reach on posts, etc.). This means queries that contain these metrics will now run, but will return empty values for these metrics.

This workaround is in place for Google Sheets, Excel, and Looker Studio destinations. We are verifying if it is safe to add to Data warehouse destinations, and we will provide an update once we confirm this.

The workaround will be removed once Meta has fixed the issue on their side.

Thank you for your patience and understanding while we work to resolve this fully.

Nov 7, 17:44 EET
Identified - We're currently experiencing an issue with our Facebook Insights data source connector, causing some customers to encounter the below error message:

“(#100) The value must be a valid insights metric”

The issue appears to be happening with queries using the Total reach metric or other metrics derived from reach.

We've reported the issue to their support team, and are working on a workaround that will allow queries to keep functioning if they include those fields.

We'll provide an update once we have additional details or have released the workaround.

Thank you for your patience and understanding while we work to resolve this.

item.title: Service disruption: Pinterest Ads, November 7, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Nov 8, 20:41 EET
Resolved - We’ve implemented a fix to overcome the issue with the Pinterest API and to make queries with campaign, targeting, and other breakdowns to work again. We are seeing queries returning to normal, and we will continue monitoring to ensure no further issues arise.

If this issue persists for your queries, or if data returned has any issues, please reach out to our customer support so we can investigate the issue further.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Nov 7, 12:29 EET
Identified - We're currently experiencing an issue with our Pinterest Ads data source connector, causing some customers to encounter the below error message:

"Error: Pinterest Ads failure (Your query took too much time to process. Please try again later.)"

Queries without dimensions or only using advertiser or date will typically work. Those with campaign, targeting, and other dimensions will likely fail with the above error.

We’ve narrowed down the issue to a problem within the Pinterest API and have reported the issue to their support team.

We'll provide an update once we have additional details related to this issue from Pinterest.

Thank you for your patience and understanding while we work to resolve this.

item.title: Service disruption: Instagram Insights, Instagram Public Data and Facebook Billing Data, October 5th, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Oct 6, 09:03 EEST
Resolved - Meta has resolved the issues that were affecting authentication in our Instagram Insights, Instagram Public Data, and Facebook Billing Data data sources.

We appreciate your patience during this time!

Oct 5, 14:55 EEST
Investigating - Meta is experiencing issues that are impacting authentication in our Instagram Insights, Instagram Public Data, and Facebook Billing Data data sources. Our teams are aware of this and have notified Meta of the issue.

This issue is wide-spread. For more information, you can follow Meta's status page:

https://metastatus.com/facebook-login

item.title: Supermetrics for Facebook Ads, September 20, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Sep 27, 18:30 EEST
Resolved - This issue has been resolved. If you continue to experience any issues with the Facebook Ads connector, please contact our customer support team for further assistance.

Sep 26, 21:36 EEST
Monitoring - Error rates have returned to baseline levels. We are continuing to monitor the platform closely to ensure there are no further issues. If this error persists for your queries, please review our article linked below which outlines steps you can take to avoid the error and reach out to our customer support team if you require further assistance.

https://support.supermetrics.com/support/solutions/articles/19000154617-facebook-ads-query-optimizations-to-reduce-errors

Sep 26, 19:00 EEST
Identified - We have implemented additional fixes and improvements to the Facebook Ads connector, and have eliminated most occurrences of this issue.

However, in some cases, particularly heavy queries may still return this error. We will continue to work with our partners at Meta to programmatically reduce the occurrences. We have created a support article that outlines steps you can take to simplify your queries and reduce the chances of getting this error: https://support.supermetrics.com/support/solutions/articles/19000154617-facebook-ads-query-optimizations-to-reduce-errors

If you continue to receive this error and the steps outlined in the support article are not helpful, please contact our support team.

Sep 25, 17:24 EEST
Update - We have implemented several changes and improvements to the Facebook Ads connector and are seeing error rates decline. However, failures still persist above our normal range, and we are continuing to work with Meta to investigate and resolve any remaining issues.

Sep 20, 19:58 EEST
Investigating - We're currently experiencing an issue with our Facebook Ads data source connector, causing some customers to encounter the below error message:

"Query failed: Facebook is currently having issues with their API. We failed to fetch the requested data with an error' job failed'. We suggest trying smaller queries until Facebook resolves the issues or please try again later."

Our teams are urgently working together with Meta to identify the root cause and return the Facebook Ads data source connector to normal functionality.

We'll provide an update once we have additional details related to this issue.
Thank you for your patience and understanding while we work to resolve this.

item.title: Service disruption: Facebook Insights, Instagram Insights and Instagram Public Data, September 13, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Sep 18, 08:59 EEST
Resolved - All issues impacting our data source connectors for Facebook Insights, Instagram Insights, and Instagram Public Data have been successfully resolved.

If you encounter any further issues or have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to our support team. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Sep 14, 17:55 EEST
Update - While Meta has marked the issue as resolved, we are continuing to experience issues fetching accounts with our connectors. We have escalated this issue to Meta as a top priority and are working with them to fully resolve this issue as quickly as possible.

Sep 13, 19:21 EEST
Update - We are continuing to work with Meta to resolve the issue as quickly as possible.

Sep 13, 11:02 EEST
Update - Meta has confirmed an issue that impacts the Graph API me/accounts endpoint, which is impacting Supermetrics Facebook Insights, Instagram Insights and Instagram Public Data data source connectors. We are currently unable to fetch the account information from Meta's API due to this situation.

Our teams are actively collaborating with Meta to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. You can follow up on the issue on Meta’s status updates. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

Sep 13, 10:34 EEST
Update - Meta is currently experiencing issues that are impacting our Facebook Insights, Instagram Insights and
Instagram Public Data data source connectors. We are unable to fetch the account information from Meta’s API.

Our teams are actively collaborating with Meta to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

Sep 13, 09:15 EEST
Investigating - Meta is currently experiencing issues that are impacting our Facebook Insights, Instagram Insights and
Instagram Public Data data source connectors. We are unable to fetch the account information from Meta’s API.

Our teams are actively collaborating with Meta to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service disruption: Supermetrics for Criteo, September 11, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Sep 11, 22:45 EEST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Sep 11, 19:58 EEST
Monitoring - This issue has been isolated to the Criteo API and can be seen on the Criteo status page here - https://status.criteo.com/

Criteo has released a fix for this issue, and we are seeing systems return to normal operation. We will continue to monitor the platform closely to ensure that there are no further issues.

Sep 11, 19:26 EEST
Investigating - We're currently experiencing an issue impacting our Criteo connector. As a result, some customers may be encountering the following error messages: Internal server timeout or Internal server error.

Our team is urgently investigating this issue, and we'll provide an update within the next 18 hours.
Thank you for your patience and understanding.

item.title: Service disruption: Supermetrics for Facebook Ads, August 23, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Aug 25, 20:05 EEST
Resolved - The issue that was impacting the performance of our Facebook Ads connector has been resolved.

We've been able to fully recover the functionality of scheduled refreshes, meaning all Facebook Ads queries on Google Sheets are now working normally.

If your scheduled refreshes previously failed, you can manually refresh them or wait until their scheduled time, and they will execute normally.

We appreciate your patience and understanding while we worked towards a solution.

Aug 25, 11:28 EEST
Identified - We have been working on recovering the performance of the Facebook Ads connector and have observed positive results. All Facebook Ads queries on Google Sheets are functioning properly when manually refreshed.

Some Facebook Ads scheduled refreshes on Google Sheets are temporarily not executed, but most of the scheduled refreshes are working normally. We've been able to process more scheduled refreshes, and we aim to keep increasing until we reach a full recovery.

In case your scheduled refresh fails, you can refresh the queries manually to update your report. Once the issue is fully resolved, all scheduled refreshes will resume functioning normally.

Our team is continuing to work together with Meta to resolve the issue and return all Facebook Ads functionality to normal levels. We’ll communicate another update within the next 8 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Aug 24, 13:12 EEST
Update - We've been able to improve the performance of the Facebook Ads connector.

Some Facebook Ads scheduled refreshes on Google Sheets are temporarily not executed, but most of the scheduled refreshes are working normally. In case your scheduled refresh fails, you can refresh the queries manually to update your report. Once the issue is fully resolved, all scheduled refreshes will resume functioning normally.

Our team is continuing to work together with Meta to resolve the issue and return all Facebook Ads functionality to normal levels. We’ll communicate another update within the next 18 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Aug 23, 20:12 EEST
Update - We continue actively working on resolving issues with Facebook Ads, and we see that in most cases the connector should already be functioning normally.

However, some slowness may be experienced for heavier queries and DWH transfers. Additionally, some Facebook Ads scheduled refreshes on Google Sheets are undergoing maintenance and are temporarily unavailable.

In case your scheduled refresh fails, you can refresh the queries manually to update your report. Your scheduled refreshes will resume functioning once the issue is resolved.

Our team is continuing to work together with Meta to resolve the issue and return all Facebook Ads functionality to normal levels. We'll communicate another update within the next 18 hours. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Aug 23, 13:35 EEST
Investigating - Due to issues with heavy load on the Facebook API, Supermetrics is currently experiencing partial service degradation with the Facebook Ads data source connector. Some Facebook Ads scheduled refreshes on Google Sheets are undergoing maintenance and are temporarily unavailable.

In case your scheduled refresh fails, you can refresh the queries manually to update your report. Your scheduled refreshes will resume functioning once the issue is resolved.

Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service disruption: Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace), July 26, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Aug 7, 12:07 EEST
Resolved - The issues related to the transfer configuration that stemmed from Google and impacted Supermetrics for BigQuery (Marketplace) have now been resolved.

The “Change Configuration” button is now functioning normally in the transfer editing mode, and the previously selected schema and account(s) are displaying properly.

While the previously established refresh window might not be visible in the user interface in transfer edit mode, please note that this does not impact the transfers themselves. The transfers are still using the updated refresh window settings that you have saved.

We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process. Should you have further questions about this issue, please don’t hesitate to contact our support team.

Aug 4, 09:15 EEST
Update - Google has made partial progress in resolving the transfer configuration issue that affects Supermetrics for BigQuery (Marketplace). The “Change Configuration” button is now functioning normally in the transfer editing mode, and previously selected schema and accounts are displaying properly.

However, the previously set refresh window is still not visible. Google has found the root cause and is working on a fix. Please note that changes made to the refresh window are saved correctly, despite the UI displaying it as empty. As a result, the runs will be scheduled using the updated refresh window.

We are closely monitoring the situation, and as soon as we receive further updates from Google, we will promptly share the latest information with you. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process.

Aug 2, 09:27 EEST
Update - Google has made partial progress in resolving the transfer configuration issue that affects Supermetrics for BigQuery (Marketplace). The “Change Configuration” button is now functioning normally in the transfer editing mode, and previously selected schema and accounts are displaying properly. However, the previously set refresh window is still not visible. Google’s teams are actively working on a complete resolution. We are closely monitoring the situation, and as soon as we receive further updates from Google, we will promptly share the latest information with you.

Please note an alternative solution to this issue is switching to a Supermetrics for BigQuery (Hub) license, as the UI issue is only impacting Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace). You can contact your customer success representative or the customer support team for additional details regarding this option. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process.

Jul 27, 20:09 EEST
Identified - Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace) is currently experiencing an issue with transfer configuration. In the edit mode of an existing transfer, the previously set refresh window is not visible, and the “Change Configuration” button has been replaced with “Connect Source”. Consequently, users are required to manually reselect the schema and accounts, as if configuring a brand new transfer.

Google has now identified the root cause of this issue that continues to impact all 3rd party connections. Their teams are actively working on a resolution and have advised that the fix rollout will start next week. We are closely monitoring the situation, and as soon as we receive additional updates from Google, we will promptly share the latest information with you.

Please note an alternative solution to this issue is switching to a Supermetrics for BigQuery (Hub) license, as the UI issue is only impacting Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace). You can contact your customer success representative or the customer support team for additional details regarding this option. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process.

Jul 27, 10:30 EEST
Update - Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace) is currently experiencing an issue with transfer configuration. In the edit mode of an existing transfer, the previously set refresh window is not visible, and the “Change Configuration” button has been replaced with “Connect Source”. Consequently, users are required to manually reselect the schema and accounts, as if configuring a brand new transfer.

Google has acknowledged that this issue is impacting all 3rd party connections, and their teams are actively working to resolve it. We are closely monitoring the situation, and as soon as we receive updates from Google, we will promptly share the latest information with you. Thank you for your patience and understanding during this process.

Please note an alternative solution to this issue is switching to a Supermetrics for BigQuery (Hub) license, as the UI issue is only impacting Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace). You can contact your customer success representative or the customer support team for additional details regarding this option. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process.

Jul 26, 14:35 EEST
Investigating - Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace) is currently experiencing an issue with transfer configuration. In the edit mode of an existing transfer, the previously set refresh window is not visible, and the “Change Configuration” button has been replaced with “Connect Source”. Consequently, users are required to manually reselect the schema and accounts, as if configuring a brand new transfer.

We have flagged this UI issue to Google, and their teams are currently working diligently to resolve it. As soon as we receive any updates from Google, we will promptly provide you with the latest information.

Please note an alternative solution to this issue is switching to a Supermetrics for BigQuery (Hub) license, as the UI issue is only impacting Supermetrics for BigQuery (marketplace). You can contact your customer success representative or the customer support team for additional details regarding this option. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding during this process.

item.title: Service disruption: BigQuery, July 20, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jul 24, 11:41 EEST
Resolved - The issue impacting Supermetrics for BigQuery has been resolved. We sincerely appreciate your patience throughout this process. Thank you all for your understanding!

Jul 21, 20:57 EEST
Update - Google teams are still actively working on a resolution to return Supermetrics service to normal. The performance of BigQuery transfers continues to improve.

To address the problem for destination datasets in a US or EU region, please run a backfill for the affected dates. For destination datasets in other regions, Google is actively working on a solution and will provide updates accordingly. We appreciate your patience as we work towards resolving this incident.

Jul 21, 15:10 EEST
Update - Google teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return Supermetrics service to normal. Notably, there has been an improvement in the performance of BigQuery transfers.

To address the problem for destination datasets in a US or EU region, please run a backfill for the affected dates. For destination datasets in other regions, Google is actively working on a solution and will provide updates accordingly. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

Jul 21, 09:39 EEST
Identified - Google has identified an ongoing issue that has impacted Supermetrics for BigQuery. Google teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal.

To address the problem for destination datasets in a US or EU region, please run a backfill for the affected dates. For destination datasets in other regions, Google is actively working on a solution and will provide updates accordingly. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

Jul 20, 17:16 EEST
Update - Our teams are currently collaborating with Google to investigate the issue with BigQuery actively. We recognize the significance of swiftly resolving this matter and remain dedicated to finding a solution. We will provide the next status update within the next 18 hours. We appreciate your patience as we work towards resolving this incident.

Jul 20, 11:34 EEST
Investigating - We're currently experiencing issues that have impacted Supermetrics for BigQuery. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service disruption: Facebook Ads, July 11, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jul 14, 15:35 EEST
Resolved - The instability with Facebook Ads data source connector is now resolved. All systems return to and maintain normal operation.

Our team will continue to monitor and are prepared to take quick actions should any further unexpected load degrade performance.

Thank you for your patience.

Jul 14, 11:26 EEST
Update - We have observed improved system performance and positive outcomes. The majority of the Facebook Ads queries are working normally and most of the Google Sheets triggered queries operate normally without delays.

We are actively monitoring the situation. Our team will provide an additional update in the next 8 hours.

Jul 13, 12:56 EEST
Update - After implementing several fixes and improvements to the Facebook Ads connector to enhance query performance, we have observed improved system performance and positive outcomes. We are actively monitoring the situation.

Note: While closely monitoring the platform for any additional issues, there will be a slight delay in parts of the Google Sheets triggered queries. However, all other functionalities of Google Sheets for Facebook Ads should be operating normally. Our team will provide an additional update in the next 18 hours.

Jul 12, 23:08 EEST
Monitoring - We have implemented a number of fixes and improvements to the Facebook Ads connector to improve query performance and are seeing positive results as systems return to normal operation.

Note: Some Google Sheets triggered queries may remain delayed as we monitor the platform closely for any further issues. All other Google Sheets Facebook Ads functionality should be normal. Our team will provide an update within 18 hours and hope to resume normal operations for all triggers at that time.

Jul 12, 16:06 EEST
Update - Due to persistent issues, the scheduled refreshes of Facebook Ads queries in Google Sheets will experience a delay of a few hours. We are actively investigating and collaborating with Meta to identify the root cause and implement a solution that will restore the connector's normal functionality. Our team will provide the next status update within the next 18 hours. We appreciate your patience as we work towards resolving this incident.

Jul 12, 11:14 EEST
Update - Our investigation into the issue is making progress as we diligently work towards identifying the root cause. The development team is actively engaged in examining various leads that have surfaced during the investigation. We understand the importance of resolving this matter swiftly and are committed to finding a solution. Our team will provide the next status update within the next 6 hours. We appreciate your patience as we work towards resolving this incident.

Jul 11, 16:22 EEST
Update - The majority of queries are functioning properly, although a few queries are experiencing delays or failures. Our ongoing efforts involve investigating the underlying cause and finding a solution to restore the connector's normal functionality. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 18 hours.

Jul 11, 10:21 EEST
Investigating - Supermetrics is currently experiencing slowness with the Facebook Ads data source connector, leading to partial degradation of service. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service disruption: Data warehouse and data lake destinations, June 29, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 30, 17:18 EEST
Resolved - We have observed all systems return to and maintain normal operation. This issue is now resolved.

Jun 29, 18:28 EEST
Monitoring - Supermetrics is currently experiencing slowness and queuing issues with data transfers, resulting in partial degradation of service in Supermetrics data warehouse and data lake destinations. Our teams have been actively working to resolve these issues and restore normal service as soon as possible. We've implemented several fixes for this issue and are seeing positive results in transfer times and success rates.

We will be monitoring the platform closely over the next 24 hours to ensure that there are no further issues.

Jun 29, 16:57 EEST
Update - Supermetrics is currently experiencing slowness and queuing issues with data transfers, resulting in partial degradation of service in Supermetrics data warehouse and data lake destinations. Our teams have been actively working to resolve these issues and restore normal service as soon as possible. We will provide another update within the next 6 hours to keep you informed. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience.

Jun 29, 11:01 EEST
Investigating - Supermetrics is currently experiencing slowness and queuing issues with data transfers, resulting in partial degradation of service in Supermetrics data warehouse and data lake destinations. Our teams are actively working to address these problems and restore normal service as quickly as possible. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 6 hours.

item.title: Service disruption: Data warehouse and data lake destinations, June 28, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 28, 23:58 EEST
Resolved - This issue has now been resolved.

Jun 28, 18:46 EEST
Monitoring - We have applied a fix and are seeing systems return to normal operation. We are continuing to monitor the platform closely to ensure there are no further issues.

Jun 28, 15:12 EEST
Investigating - Supermetrics is currently experiencing slowness and queuing issues with data transfers, resulting in partial degradation of service in Supermetrics data warehouse and data lake destinations. Our teams are actively working to address these problems and restore normal service as quickly as possible.

item.title: Service disruption: TikTok Ads and TikTok Organic, June 7, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 13, 09:51 EEST
Resolved - TikTok has provided an update on the ongoing issues. Audience insight data after 2023-06-05 UTC returned to normal on 2023-06-09 17:05 UTC.

All service issues on their end that impacted our TikTok Ads and TikTok Organic connectors have been resolved. If you have queries or transfers affected by the issues from TikTok, please refresh your affected queries or run a backfill for the affected date range.

Jun 9, 11:34 EEST
Update - TikTok has provided an update on the ongoing issues.

The data latency for Content Ads from 2023-06-02 to 2023-06-06 UTC has been resolved. Data for 2023-06-06 UTC became available from 2023-06-08 07:45 UTC. However, there is a delay in Audience insight data after 2023-06-05 UTC.

TikTok is actively working on resolving this issue and will provide an estimated timeline for the fix as soon as possible. We will continue to provide updates on the issue status on this page.

Jun 8, 09:47 EEST
Identified - TikTok has provided an update regarding the issues.

The issue with Video insights data has been resolved. However, there is a delay in the availability of Audience data for the US. Additionally, the ads data for Content Ads (HTC, BE, BM) from June 4th to June 6th is also delayed, but the data for June 2nd to June 3rd is now available.

We will provide updates as soon as all the issues have been resolved.

Jun 7, 11:28 EEST
Investigating - TikTok has identified an ongoing issue, from which the Supermetrics TikTok Ads and TikTok Organic connectors may have encountered performance degradation and data latency issues starting from 2023-06-02 14:00 UTC. We will provide updates as soon as all the issues have been resolved.

item.title: Service disruption: Twitter Premium and Twitter Organic, May 17, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 7, 14:49 EEST
Resolved - Unfortunately, Twitter is still experiencing issues and we have identified that our Twitter Premium and Twitter Organic data sources are affected. Some queries from these data sources are incorrectly returning discrepant or null data.

It's important to note that since the issue originates from Twitter, Supermetrics does not have direct control over it.

If you have any questions, please reach out to our support team.

Jun 7, 14:00 EEST
Update - Unfortunately, Twitter is still experiencing issues and we have identified that our Twitter Premium and Twitter Organic data sources are affected.

Some queries from these data sources are incorrectly returning discrepant or null data.

Our teams will continue to monitor Twitter’s status updates. If you have any questions, please reach out to our support team.

Jun 7, 13:59 EEST
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

May 31, 13:33 EEST
Update - Unfortunately, Twitter is still experiencing issues and we have identified that our Twitter Premium and Twitter Organic data sources are affected.

Some queries from these data sources are incorrectly returning discrepant or null data.

Our teams will continue to monitor Twitter’s status updates. If you have any questions, please reach out to our support team.

May 25, 13:43 EEST
Update - Unfortunately, Twitter is still experiencing issues that are impacting our Twitter Premium data source connector.

The Tweet Engagement report is working. However, Tweet Historical is still affected and may return the null data.

Our teams are paying close attention to Twitter’s status updates. If you have any questions, please reach out to the support team.

May 22, 15:03 EEST
Identified - Twitter is still experiencing issues that are impacting our Twitter Premium data source connector. These issues may incorrectly return metrics with null data for some queries.

Our teams are paying close attention to Twitter’s status updates. We'll update you as soon as the issue is resolved.

May 17, 16:18 EEST
Investigating - The Twitter Premium data source is currently experiencing issues, as the Twitter API is incorrectly returning metrics with null data for some queries.

Our teams are working with Twitter to resolve the situation.

item.title: Service disruption: Google data sources, June 6, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 6, 19:22 EEST
Resolved - All service disruptions associated with the issue Google was experiencing today have been resolved. Our Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Analytics 4, Google Display & Video 360, and Google Campaign Manager 360 connectors are now working normally. Thank you for your patience.

Jun 6, 18:28 EEST
Update - Google began experiencing an issue at 4 p.m. EEST today that may be causing errors for our following data sources: Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Analytics 4, Google Display & Video 360, and Google Campaign Manager 360. Our teams are urgently working with Google to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. More info on Google’s status page:

Google Ads Status Dashboard

Jun 6, 18:24 EEST
Update - Google began experiencing an issue at 4 p.m. EEST today that may be causing errors for our following data sources: Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Analytics 4, Google Display & Video 360, and Google Campaign Manager 360. Our teams are urgently working with Google to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. More info on Google’s status page:

Google Ads Status Dashboard

Jun 6, 17:34 EEST
Identified - Google began experiencing an issue at 4 p.m. EEST today that may be causing errors for our following data sources: Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Analytics 4, Google Display & Video 360, and Google Campaign Manager 360. Our teams are urgently working with Google to resolve the situation and return our service to normal. More info on Google’s status page: Google Ads Status Dashboard

item.title: Service disruption: Twitter Organic, June 5, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 5, 10:02 EEST
Resolved - All service issues have been resolved. Supermetrics is working as normal.

Jun 5, 09:03 EEST
Investigating - We're currently experiencing issues that have impacted Supermetrics Twitter Organic connector. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal.

item.title: Service disruption: Twitter connectors, June 5, 2023
item.content:encoded:
Jun 5, 08:53 EEST
Resolved - All service issues have been resolved. Supermetrics is working as normal.

Jun 5, 08:20 EEST
Investigating - We're currently experiencing issues that have impacted Supermetrics Twitter Ads, Twitter Organic, and Twitter Premium connectors. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal.

item.title: Service disruption: Looker studio, May 25, 2023
item.content:encoded:
May 29, 16:39 EEST
Resolved - The loading issue in Looker Studio has now been resolved. Looker Studio connectors are now working normally. Please refresh your dashboards to have all the latest changes reflected. Thank you for your patience.

May 26, 16:07 EEST
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

May 26, 14:54 EEST
Monitoring - We’ve released updates to our connectors and Looker Studio is now working as expected. We'll continue to monitor the situation. Please refresh your reports, and if you encounter any issues do not hesitate to contact us at support@supermetrics.com

May 26, 02:21 EEST
Update - We’re continuing to investigate the issue causing the unusually long loading times in Looker Studio. Our team has released some fixes, and we recommend users to try refreshing their reports. We’ll provide an additional update in the next 12 hours. We appreciate your patience.

May 25, 12:04 EEST
Investigating - Looker Studio is experiencing unusually long loading times. Our team is communicating with Google to resolve the issue.

We kindly ask you to be patient while loading your reports.

item.title: Service disruption: All Supermetrics services, May 22, 2023
item.content:encoded:
May 22, 12:37 EEST
Resolved - All service issues have been resolved. Supermetrics — including all queries and scheduled report refreshes — is working as normal.

May 22, 10:37 EEST
Investigating - All Supermetrics services are currently experiencing issues that may be causing performance issues with our products. Our teams are urgently working to resolve the situation and return our service to normal.
